oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Abdullah, King of Jordan, 1882-1951; Arab Revolt, 1936-1939; Battles; British Mandate of Palestine, 1922-1948; British-Jewish relations; Historical events; Ḥusayn ibn ʻAlī, King of Hejaz, 1853?-1931; Ibn Saʻūd, King of Saudi Arabia, 1880-1953; Islam; Jewish immigration; Ottoman Empire; Persecution; Settler colonialism; World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1939-1945; al-Kābrī Battle, 1948; Arab Revolt, 1936-1939; Brothers; Children's games; Dayr Yāsīn Massacre, 1948; Disputes; Honor; Islamic education; Leaders; Murder; Psychological warfare; Rape; Terrorism; ʻAmqā (Palestine); ʻArrābah (Palestine); al-Kābrī Battle, 1948; Arab countries; British-Jewish relations; Displacement; Hospitality; Living conditions; Manners; Mistreatment; Nahr al-Bārid (Palestinian refugee camp: Lebanon); Palestinian national identity; Psychological warfare; Refugee aid; Routes; Seeking refuge; Suffering; Terrorism; Trade; United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East; Work; ʻAmqā (Palestine)

oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on June 27, 1997 with Qāsim Rāghib Dīb, male, born in 1922 in ʻAmqā, Palestine and resides in Nahr al-Bārid Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع قاسم راغب ديب في 27 حزيران يونيو عام 1997، ذكر، ولد عام 1922 في عمقا، فلسطين ويقيم في مخيم نهر البارد للاجئين الفلسطنيين، لبنان.
